Package io.artframework

Interface ArtProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Provider, Scoped
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActionProvider, RequirementProvider, TriggerProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultActionProvider, DefaultArtProvider, DefaultRequirementProvider, DefaultTriggerProvider
    public interface ArtProvider
extends Provider
    The ArtProvider holds and handles all ART that is registered. Use it to register your ART or to retrieve registered implementations for a given identifier.

    You can also scan a path or JAR file and automatically register all ART that is found. Use the find() and the AbstractFinder to find specific ART in your files and load the FinderResult with the FinderResult.load(Scope) method.

    By default the ART-Framework will not scan the whole classpath. You can enable this by setting Settings.autoRegisterAllArt(boolean) to 

    true
    .

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static ArtProvider of​(Scope scope)

      • find

        default FinderProvider find()
        Gets the AbstractFinder to find ArtObjects inside your classpath or file tree. Use the FinderResult to register the found art objects with the ArtProvider.
        Returns:
        The AbstractFinder to find ArtObjects in your filesystem and classpath.

      • addAll

        ArtProvider addAll​(java.util.Collection<ArtObjectMeta<?>> artObjects)
        Adds all of the provided ArtObjects to the relevant ArtProvider. Make sure that ArtObjectMeta.initialized() returns true. Otherwise the registration will fail.
        Parameters:
        artObjects - The list of ArtObjects that should be added to the provider
        Returns:
        this ArtProvider

      • addAllOf

        default ArtProvider addAllOf​(java.lang.Class<?> codeSource)
        Takes given class finds it code source and adds all art-objects inside it to the scope.

        The classloader of the given class will be used to load any unloaded classes.

        This is an easy method to load all art inside the own plugin as art-objects.

        Parameters:
        codeSource - a class inside the jar file that should be scanned
        Returns:
        this art provider

        default RequirementProvider requirements()

        default TriggerProvider trigger()

      • targets

        default TargetProvider targets()
